alert.note: Alert for Gove; Sheridan (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 3:54PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Sheridan and northeastern Gove Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 354 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southeast of Park, or 4 miles west of Quinter, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Quinter around 405 PM CDT. Park around 410 PM CDT. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 101 and 107. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
